Posts.Content: Thank you for the update! Good to hear the breast surgeon gave you news that most likely brought a sigh of relief. Hope it never gets to a stage thatÂ makes you nervous again.....I know the edgy feeling it gives.
Posts.Title: 25 Years old - Family HX of breast and ovarian CA - Dr. found lump, does not show up on ultrasound

Posts.Content:
Hey guys,
Hope all's well?
I finally saw the breast surgeon; he concluded it's Fibroadenoma too and gave me the option of a fine needle biopsy or leave it as is & monitor by ultrasound on a 6 mth period. I opted to wait & watch with the u/sound. He's thinks I may notice more activity with my periods, so I guess I have to observe. He did advs tho, that if it got problematic before the 6 mths are up to get back to him.
Now with the size of the lump reduced and the tenderness gone, it's still warm and it pricks like a dog-gone needle around that area. This doeasn't happen often...like once a day for a few minutes but enough to make me cringe. Anybody experienced this?
Neways, so much for me. How are you guys doing out there?
Posts.Title: 25 Years old - Family HX of breast and ovarian CA - Dr. found lump, does not show up on ultrasound
